alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 8:10PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Cherry and northeastern Sheridan Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 709 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gordon, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Clinton, Rock Hill, Bayonne and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road. This includes Highway 20 between mile markers 98 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
